intro: Glochidopleurum sintenisii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa, characterized by its thick, succulent stems that store water. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers, and its leaves are often modified into spines or reduced to scales. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is also noted for its latex, which can be toxic and is used in traditional medicine.
